prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.

Two friends from the small village of Kasai embarked on a hunting trip by the river one evening. The weather shifted unexpectedly, turning foggy and calm. Suddenly, they heard distant war cries, causing them to worry that an enemy war party was approaching. They quickly hid behind a log, watching as several canoes approached. One canoe came close, carrying five men who invited them to join in a raid upriver. One hunter declined, concerned for his safety and the well-being of his family, but the other chose to go along.

The war party proceeded up the river and attacked a distant village. During the battle, one warrior announced that their new companion had been injured. Upon hearing this, the young man realized that he was among ghosts and feared for his life. He did not feel sick, but the warriors claimed that he had been shot.

They paddled back to Kasai before dawn, and the young man returned home, starting a fire and recounting the night's events. He explained how he fought alongside the ghostly warriors, witnessing numerous deaths on both sides. People were shocked to learn that he had accompanied ghosts on a battle. As the sun rose, the young man collapsed, black liquid seeped from his mouth, and he passed away, leaving the village in grief and fear.

In the quaint hamlet of Llanidan, two companions decided to venture into the woods for a hunting expedition at dusk. The weather took a surprising turn, wrapping the area in a dense fog and stillness. Scrambling for cover, they hid behind a large tree trunk, watching in disbelief as a flotilla of canoes approached. A particular canoe moved nearer, carrying five figures who, to their shock, invited them to partake in a raid upstream. One hunter declined, fearing for his own safety and that of his loved ones, but the other, driven by curiosity and bravado, agreed to the proposition.

The battle party progressed up the river, launching a surprise attack on a distant settlement. During the chaos, one warrior revealed that their new companion had been injured. Panic coursed through the young man as he realized he was surrounded by spectral beings. He feared for his very existence, though no physical pain was present, as the ethereal warriors claimed a poisoned arrow had struck him.

They paddled back to Llanidan prior to dawn. Entering his home and starting a fire, the young man recounted the night's harrowing events. Stunned silence fell upon those present as he described willingly joining forces with ghostly warriors and bearing witness to numerous casualties on both sides.

As the sun illuminated the morning sky, the young man succumbed to his mysterious ailment, blood-red liquid oozing from his mouth. Horror gripped the hamlet as they mourned the loss of their friend, now forever changed in their minds as one who had accompanied ghosts in war.
